meanings.definition: The upper edge of anything hollow; rim; brink.
meanings.sent1: The brims of the cup were delicate and finely crafted.
meanings.sent2: She carefully filled the bowl to the brims with soup.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the brims of the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement brims over the edge like water overflowing a cup.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the brims of the canyon, creating a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The top or rim of a vessel or other container.
meanings.sent1: The brims of the teapot were adorned with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: He poured the tea up to the brims of the cups.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten perched on the brims of the fishbowl.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled over the brims of the glass, filling the room.
meanings.sent5: The steam rose from the brims of the cauldron, carrying a delicious aroma.

meanings.definition: To be full to the brim.
meanings.sent1: The excitement brims in her eyes as she opens the gift.
meanings.sent2: The river brims with water after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: His heart brims with joy at the sight of his family.
meanings.sent4: Her voice brims with emotion as she sings the heartfelt song.
meanings.sent5: The garden brims with colorful flowers, creating a beautiful display.
